heisig_chinese_memo: I see this hanzi as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks.
heisig_story: After the drop and the glass canopy, we come to a combination of three strokes that we met only once before, in the character for mama (frame 105). The pictographic meaning we gave it there has no etymological relationship to this character, but use it if it helps.
koohiiStory1: I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks.
koohiiStory2: Cinnabar (‰∏π) colored boat, the extra drop signifying that the paint hasn¬¥t dried yet. The stick represents the oars.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The boat radical and the boat kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji Ëàπ, though there's an extra reading there as well, „Åµ„Å™. They're close, so you should be able to remember it based off of „Åµ„Å≠.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Try to answer „Åµ„Å™ a couple times when doing your reviews. It'll help when we get to the vocab part.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I see this hanzi as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks.
humanum_full_description_en:
Ancient wooden boats were dug out from big trees. "Shuowen" says: "Boats, boats. The ancients used the drums together, and the woods were used as boats, and the woods were used as boats. It was impossible to help them." Xu Shen believes that in ancient times, both drums and Huodi were digging wood. Use empty boats and cut wood as oars to cross the river. The word " boat " oracle-bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions are pictographic characters, resembling a wooden boat, with the original meaning of a boat. After the Warring States period, due to the " boat " word written with " month " shape fairly close to a lot of word " boat " and the next " month off" mixed, such as " I ", " clothing " and so on.

The word " zhou " oracle bone inscription is used as the name of the country. The handed down documents still have such use cases, such as "Guoyu. "Zheng Yu": "The bald surname is the Zhouren, and the Zhou is destroyed." Wei Zhao's note: "The bald surname is the difference between the ancestors of Peng. The Zhouren, the name of the country." Suspected " zhou " oracle bone inscriptions can also be used as sacrificial names, such as "Tunnan" 2296: "Geng Shen Bu, Zhou Liao two prisons." " Liao " is also the name of the sacrifice, " jail " refers to the cattle in captivity, so the whole sentence refers to the divination on the Gengshen Day, and the boat sacrifice and the burning sacrifice are performed with two cows. Others think that the word " boat " is used as the original meaning, such as "He Ji" 24609: "Wang Qi found a boat in the river." Yu Xingwu believes that "seeking a boat" refers to sailing along the water. Here it means that Wang Shunshui crosses the river by boat. I think " Xun " is the name of the sacrifice, and " boat " is also used as the name of the sacrifice. The Chinese character "Ëàü" is used as the original meaning. For example, Ejun Qizhou Festival: "Tuns three boats as one voyage", which refers to gathering three ships as a group to sail. In addition, Uncle Tang and Father Ding had the term "boat dragon." Zhang Zhenghong thought it meant a boat in the shape of a dragon. The inscription of the word " zhou " can also be used as the name of a clan and a person.

" Boat " word handed down in literature can pass for " weeks ." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Da Dong": "The son of the boatman, Xiong Feng is Qiu." Zheng Xuanjian: "The boat, treat it as Zhou."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions like a boat and a ship. "Shuowen" says: "A boat, a boat."

    Ancient wooden boats were dug out from big trees. "Shuowen" says: "Boats, boats. The ancients used the drums together, and the woods were used as boats, and the woods were used as boats. It was impossible to help them." Xu Shen believes that in ancient times, both drums and Huodi were digging wood. Use empty boats and cut wood as oars to cross the river. The word " boat" oracle-bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions are pictographic characters, resembling a wooden boat, with the original meaning of a boat. After the Warring States period, due to the " boat" word written with " month" shape fairly close to a lot of word " boat" and the next " month off" mixed, such as " I", " clothing" and so on. The word " zhou" oracle bone inscription is used as the name of the country. The handed down documents still have such use cases, such as "Guoyu. "Zheng Yu": "The bald surname is the Zhouren, and the Zhou is destroyed." Wei Zhao's note: "The bald surname is the difference between the ancestors of Peng. The Zhouren, the name of the country." Suspected " zhou" oracle bone inscriptions can also be used as sacrificial names, such as "Tunnan" 2296: "Geng Shen Bu, Zhou Liao two prisons." " Liao" is also the name of the sacrifice, " jail" refers to the cattle in captivity, so the whole sentence refers to the divination on the Gengshen Day, and the boat sacrifice and the burning sacrifice are performed with two cows. Others think that the word " boat" is used as the original meaning, such as "He Ji" 24609: "Wang Qi found a boat in the river." Yu Xingwu believes that "seeking a boat" refers to sailing along the water. Here it means that Wang Shunshui crosses the river by boat. I think " Xun" is the name of the sacrifice, and " boat" is also used as the name of the sacrifice. The Chinese character " Ëàü" is used as the original meaning. For example, Ejun Qizhou Festival: "Tuns three boats as one voyage", which refers to gathering three ships as a group to sail. In addition, Uncle Tang and Father Ding had the term "boat dragon." Zhang Zhenghong thought it meant a boat in the shape of a dragon. The inscription of the word " zhou" can also be used as the name of a clan and a person. " Boat" word handed down in literature can pass for " weeks." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Da Dong": "The son of the boatman, Xiong Feng is Qiu." Zheng Xuanjian: "The boat, treat it as Zhou."
